hints.content:
We can think of $\blueD{10} \times \greenD{5}$ as $\blueD{10}$ rows of $\greenD{5}$ circles. How many circles are there?

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: An array of 50 circles arranged in 10 rows of 5 circles each. The rows are labeled 1 through 10. The columns are labeled 1 through 5. Every circle is labeled with a number. The circles in the first row are labeled 1 through 5. The circles in the second row are labeled 6 through 10. The circles in the third row are labeled 11 through 15. The circles in the fourth row are labeled 16 through 20. The circles in the fifth row are labeled 21 through 25. The circles in the sixth row are labeled 26 through 30. The circles in the seventh row are labeled 31 through 35. The circles in the eighth row are labeled 36 through 40. The circles in the ninth row are labeled 41 through 45. The circles in the tenth row are labeled 46 through 50. !
